* Many positions are dead ends

job_title: Teacher, Elementary School in Reading, PA
pros: Lovely company and great staff
cons: I have no complaints for this company

pros: Many people care about the state of the university. The professors especially seem to care very much about their students' success. And the staff are concerned with keeping the school running smoothly. Most people on campus are friendly, employees and students alike. It's a great community with a beautiful campus, located in a quiet town that is close to anything you might need.
cons: There seems to be a significant disconnect between the faculty (professors) and the staff (non-faculty employees), compounded by their membership in two different unions (one for faculty, one for staff) who don't work together when negotiations occur with PASSHE. Often, one group is used against the other in the negotiations process, i.e. "staff accepted decreased medical benefits, so faculty should, too." Sometimes, a staff member and faculty member don't work well together, citing "not in my job description" as a reason to not do a certain, simple task.

pros:
Students, Career Development Center, Rohrbach Library, and Communications department.

The campus is beautiful.
cons: Socially inept administration putting profit before students. Programs and athletic teams have been dismantled. Layoff and retrenchment of staff and faculty, and a lack of commitment to both groups. Tuition increase. Campus lacks a diverse population. Negative, punishment-based work environment without thoughts to people, their families, and their careers. APSCUF (union) talks big, but does little to help or bring about change for temporary and non-tenured professors. Administration divorced from daily struggles of students, faculty, and staff.

review_title: Worked in multiple student positions at KU
pros: Had 3 different positions with 3 different departments on campus, all were flexible and willing to work with schedules as a student, all positions provided oppurtunities to get more involved on campus and meet new people as well as make a little extra cash.
cons: While there is a decent amount of on campus student employment, it is very competitive, can be difficult to get more hours first starting out, and opportunities greatly vary based on your major.

pros: Good benefits and tuition waiver program, not the worst job in the world or the worst place to work in the world.
cons: Cutting the custodial departments budget to much, hard to properly function or uphold good standards.  Short handed

review_title: I'm really going to miss the UWC...
pros: As a Writing Center Tutor, I enjoyed a great atmosphere, ability to work on homework during lulls, and amazing coworkers. You also work with a huge diversity of students, and the vast majority come away having learned something new. Also, we recently moved locations and doubled our session numbers!
cons: The usual downsides to a teaching position, I suppose. Sometimes your communication style just won't jive with a student, which can lead to a frustrating session.

it was a great time and experience i recommend it to any student interested in a part time job

Most of the time you deal with alumni who do not wish to donate and/or speak with you. Must have thick skin as some alumni do get pretty mean

pros: Set procedures and very friendly environment.
cons: Not much room for growth. I was required to take care of the supervisor duties when my supervisor left. I was given no pay advancement or job title advancement. After 5 months i was told I would get out of class pay for the responsibilities I was handling and this was canceled after 3 months with no one letting me know that it was canceled.

pros: I like the fact there are many opportunities to find a job on campus and in the surrounding area!
cons: Great options when it comes to working for the university. Integrating a  hybrid-style program to allow students find entry-level jobs through the University would be beneficial.

pros: Work closely with students, $8.33 an hour approximately, leadership and personal growth opportunities.
